questions.question_text: What are two possible counts of control plane nodes in a Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Workload Cluster? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
A. 3
E. 1
vSphere with Supervisor cluster On clusters that run in vSphere with Tanzu, you can only run either 1 control plane node or 3 control plane nodes. You can scale up the number of control plane nodes from 1 to 3, but you cannot scale down the number from 3 to 1.

A & E
Dev Plan 1
Prod Plan 3

A,B,E
Didn't mention the deployment plan if it is dev plan minimum control plane nodes are 1
prod plan 3 & 5

questions.question_text: What are the three Cluster API providers being used in VMware Tanzu Kubernetes Grid? (Choose three.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BEF
AWS (CAPA), Azure (CAPZ), vSphere (CAPV),

questions.question_text: Which two package management tools can be used to configure and install applications on Kubernetes? (Choose two.)
What project does Contour leverage for the data plane?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Contour is an ingress controller for Kubernetes that leverages Envoy in the data plane.

https://tanzu.vmware.com/developer/guides/service-routing-contour-refarch/

Selected Answer: B
The Tanzu Kubernetes Grid Service supports two CNI options for Tanzu Kubernetes clusters: Antrea and Calico. The system-defined default CNI is Antrea. 
https://techdocs.broadcom.com/us/en/vmware-cis/vsphere/vsphere-supervisor/7-0/vsphere-with-tanzu-configuration-and-management-7-0/configuring-and-managing-a-supervisor-cluster/change-the-default-cni-for-tanzu-kubernetes-clusters.html
